result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel R Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joel R Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joel R Johnson was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Habitual Criminality], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:15 AM Defendant Joel R Johnson appeared by video zoom from Waupaca County Jail.   attorney Nils Wyosnick by video zoom  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video zoom. Court Reporter Tamille Bell present by audio zoom.  Victim notification rights complied with.  Defendant waived right for in person proceeding. Complaint forms basis.  Court accepted plea, adjudged guilty. No corrections to PSI.  No victims are present   Sentencing statements.  Statement by defendant.  Court imposed in 15CF206 on Ct 1, 1 year jail with huber.  May transfer to Wood County subject to jail rules.  48 month revocation/AODA and comply/48 month IID.  Fine $2477.00 due 60 days.  Submit DNA sample.  2 days jail credit.  Ct 2 dismissed.  In 18CF31, case read in and dismissed.  In 16CF150, Ct 1, Felony BJ, could imposed 6 month jail with huber consecutive to any other sentence.  Costs $518.00 due 60 days.  AODA.  Submit DNA sample.  73 days jail credit.  11:20 am

10:26 AM Cases called: 15CF206, 16CF150 & 18CF31, Defendant Joel R Johnson in court with attorney Nils Wyosnick.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 in 16CF150. Count 2 read in and dismissed. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. PSI ordered, to be completed by Jan. 22, 2020. At sentencing, defendant to plead to 15CF206 and 18CF31 to be read in and dismissed.

ADA Crystal Long appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person with Atty Nils Wyosnick.  15CF206,17CF63,16CF150 also called.  Parties have not reached agreement.  Defendant requested jury trials be scheduled.  Court questioned why today was scheduled.  ADA Long states no preliminary hearing held in 17CF63 and 18CF31.  Recess.  15CF206 will be put on for priority scheduling.  ADA Long states analyst is needed.  Atty Wyosnick willing to waive preliminary hearings.  Recess to allow paperwork to be filled out.  2:41 pm Court resumes.  17CF63 and 18CF31 preliminary hearing waivers filed.  Rights/Elements.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause exists and matter to be bound over for trial in Br 1.  Arraignment 11-15-19 @ 9 AM.
